name: Test connecting to chat and sending a message

file W:\pyProjects\vitalSyncBackend-v2\tests\test_chat_messages.py, line 9
  @allure.feature("Chat Messages")
  @allure.story("WebSocket Chat")
  @allure.title("Test connecting to chat and sending a message")
  @pytest.mark.asyncio
  async def test_chat_connect(client, test_db, mock_firebase, mock_qdrant):
      user = User(id="test_user_id", email="test@example.com")
      test_db.add(user)
      test_db.commit()

      sio = socketio.AsyncClient()
      await sio.connect("http://localhost:8000", namespaces="/api/v1/chat",
                        headers={"Authorization": "Bearer valid_token"})
      await sio.emit("message", {"content": "Test message"}, namespace="/api/v1/chat")

      async def on_message(data):
          assert data["content"] == "Test message"

      sio.on("message", on_message, namespace="/api/v1/chat")
      await asyncio.sleep(1)
      await sio.disconnect()
